attributes.description: Sampling frequency for inertial sensor outputs to capture fine-grain motion dynamics.
attributes.name: sampleFrequency

attributes.description: Redundancy strategy implemented to maintain continuous navigation computations even upon component failures.
attributes.name: redundancyStrategy

attributes.description: Processing interval required to compute sensor fusion outputs in real-time.
attributes.name: computationInterval

attributes.description: Navigation precision including computed position, velocity, and attitude with minimal drift.
attributes.name: navigationAccuracy

designScenario.description: The Inertial Navigation System (INS) is engineered as a primary avionics subsystem to deliver autonomous, high-accuracy navigation data. It fuses inputs from precision accelerometers and gyroscopes, ensuring continuous computation of aircraft trajectory, orientation, and velocity. Designed for operation in both nominal and degraded environments, it enhances overall flight safety and performance by supplying real-time data to the central flight management suite. The system is modular, scalable, and certified to meet stringent aviation standards, making it integral to modern high-speed, agile aircraft.
designScenario.name: Inertial Navigation System

details.description: Compute accurate three-dimensional position, velocity, and attitude by fusing data from advanced inertial sensors every 8ms.
Function autonomously without external navigational aids, ensuring operational continuity in GNSS-denied conditions.
Maintain a high sampling rate of 2kHz and processing cycle of 8ms to support rapid dynamic flight conditions.
Deliver processed navigational outputs with minimal latency to support split-second flight control decisions.
Implement dual-redundant sensor arrays with cross-check algorithms to provide continuous fault detection and correction.
Integrate real-time health monitoring and diagnostic routines that trigger immediate alerts upon anomaly detection.

requirements.title: Robust Fault Tolerance and Safety Monitoring

details.description: Ensure seamless integration with the Central Flight Management Interface via standardized data buses.
Adopt state-of-the-art cybersecurity measures for system maintainability and protection against external threats.

relationships.description: The Inertial Navigation Unit comprises the Advanced Accelerometer Array, providing critical linear acceleration data.
The Inertial Navigation Unit comprises the Gyroscope Array to capture angular motion and rotational dynamics.
The Sensor Fusion Engine aggregates data from both the Accelerometer Array and Gyroscope Array to compute navigation parameters.
The Fault Diagnostic Module monitors the performance of the sensor apparatus and communicates issues to the Central Flight Management Interface.

systemComponents.description: Primary computing unit for inertial data acquisition, sensor fusion, and health diagnostics.
systemComponents.name: Inertial Navigation Unit

subComponents.description: A high-precision array of accelerometers designed to measure multi-axis linear movements with enhanced sensitivity.
subComponents.name: Advanced Accelerometer Array

subComponents.description: A set of high-fidelity gyroscopes that capture angular velocity, critical for attitude determination.
subComponents.name: Gyroscope Array

subComponents.description: A dedicated processing core that fuses sensor outputs to derive real-time navigational information.
subComponents.name: Sensor Fusion Engine

subComponents.description: A subsystem that continuously monitors sensor inputs and system diagnostics, triggering alerts on fault detection.
subComponents.name: Fault Diagnostic Module

systemComponents.description: Interface module that integrates INS outputs with the aircraft's central flight control and navigation management systems.
systemComponents.name: Central Flight Management Interface

compositions.name: Navigation Sensor Suite Part of INS
Data Processing Unit Part of INS
User Interface and Control Part of INS
